title: Naseeb Apna Apna
descriptions:
Naseeb Apna Apna (1986) is a Hindi-language family drama-comedy about fate, friendship, and the clash between values and wealth. The story centers on two close friends from a small town: Kishan, an honest, contented, middle-class young man raised to value hard work and integrity; and Kanhaiya, a more carefree and ambitious fellow who believes fortune favors the bold. Their contrasting philosophies are put to the test when both cross paths with the wealthy industrialist Dhanraj and his household.

Kishan meets and falls in love with Radha, a kind-hearted woman connected to Dhanraj’s family. Their romance highlights Kishan’s grounded nature, but it also draws him into the orbit of the rich, where he is viewed with suspicion by those who equate status with worth. Kanhaiya, meanwhile, is dazzled by the allure of quick success and becomes entangled with the glamorous but complicated Sona, whose own ambitions and insecurities mirror the seductive pull of high society. As the friends’ lives intertwine with the industrialist’s schemes and the household’s internal rivalries, misunderstandings and class prejudices strain loyalties.

A series of comic misadventures, mistaken identities, and moral tests follow. Kishan’s refusal to compromise his principles puts him at odds with powerful figures, while Kanhaiya’s shortcuts lead to precarious situations that threaten to unravel both his romance and his bond with Kishan. The narrative explores how external pressures—greed, social standing, and family expectations—can distort relationships, yet also how resilience and sincerity can mend them.

Ultimately, hard truths come to light about manipulations within Dhanraj’s sphere, exposing who truly values love and loyalty over wealth. Kishan’s steadfastness earns him respect, and Kanhaiya, chastened by near-ruin, learns that luck (naseeb) is shaped as much by character as by chance. The friends reconcile, the right couples unite, and the families bridge their divides. The film closes on a hopeful note, reaffirming that while destiny plays its part, it is one’s own choices—apna apna—that determine the course of happiness.
